alert.note: Alert for Chinle Valley; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 2:02AM MST until January 07 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, with higher amounts of 3 to 6 inches above 5500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 3500 feet near Camp Verde, Chinle, Chino Valley, Congress, Cottonwood, Dilkon, Holbrook, Kayenta, Kykotsmovi, Paulden, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Sedona, Seligman, Snowflake-Taylor, Tuba City and Winslow. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Snow forecast from 2 AM Today to 5 PM Today: Camp Verde 0 to 1 inches Chinle 1 to 3 inches Chino Valley 2 to 4 inches Congress 0 to 1 inches Cottonwood 0 to 1 inches Dilkon 1 to 3 inches Holbrook 0 to 1 inches Kayenta 1 to 3 inches Kykotsmovi 1 to 3 inches Paulden 1 to 3 inches Prescott 3 to 5 inches Prescott Valley 2 to 4 inches Sedona 4 to 6 inches Seligman 1 to 3 inches Snowflake-Taylr 1 to 2 inches Tuba City 0 to 1 inches Winslow 0 to 1 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
